thread.title: Fraudsters claim £110m a year by lying about being single
thread.title_full: Fraudsters claim £110m a year by lying about being single

title: Fraudsters claim £110m a year by lying about being single
text: show ad Revealed: Benefit fraudsters cost taxpayers £110million a year by lying about being single Private data company will be hired to find out which benefit claimants are secretly living with a partner Crackdown will target recipients of Income Support, which pays out at least £57.90 a week to single households with no income 1.5 per cent of Income Support is overpaid as a result of a claimant failing to declare they live with their partner. Published: 16:20 GMT, 9 February 2017 | Updated: 17:17 GMT, 9 February 2017 39 shares
